courseName: ME EN 101: Static Systems in Mechanical Engineering

courseSupport.tas: Several course TAs available in room CB 110
courseSupport.taOfficeHours: Times and location posted to Learning Suite during first week

courseStructure.attendance: Student success strongly correlated with regular attendance
courseStructure.sicknessPolicy: Students with fever, cough, shortness of breath, chills, muscle pain, sore throat, or loss of taste/smell should not attend and should develop study plan with instructor

courseOverview: The study of engineering statics provides exciting and insightful understanding of phenomena in the world around us. The course is rigorous and mathematically intensive, involving class discussions, text readings, problem-solving, special projects, and real-world static scenarios.
timeExpectation: For each hour in class, expect to spend at least 2 hours outside of class on the subject (for B grade). More time required for excellence (A grade).
courseObjectives: Provide understanding and ability to mathematically model engineering statics systems, learn structured approach to solving real-world problems, and understand the broader mechanical engineering discipline.

coreTopics.competency: Understanding of forces and moments with ability to perform mathematical manipulation using vector analysis
Ability to construct free-body diagrams and calculate reactions for static equilibrium of particles and rigid bodies
Understanding of force and moment systems with ability to determine internal forces and moments in members
Ability to apply computing techniques to explore solutions by changing variables and produce publication-quality figures
Ability to calculate centroids and moments of inertia for 2-D and 3-D objects
Understanding of friction and ability to model it in static systems
Understanding of design process with professional and ethical responsibilities; ability to apply to design, build, and test structures
Ability to describe ME EN problem-solving process and transform real-world scenarios into analyzable statics problems
Ability to use SAFER method to effectively communicate steps, results, and objectives of engineering analysis
Understanding of ME as a discipline and how statics relates to core ME topics and becoming an influential engineer

Learn from failures, persevere in pursuit of long-term goals, embrace challenge, recognize effort leads to mastery
Innovative experts solving significant real-world problems using state-of-the-art practices and technologies

Lead in ethical behavior regardless of position, focus on greater good, make tough decisions, inspire with praise and recognize contributions
Consistently develop new skills and use abilities to enhance lives of others
